definition: to antagonize people/to make an enemy of sb
tree/CL:棵[ke1]/to cultivate/to set up
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: There was no point in having a permanent enemy among the warders .
sentences.chinese: 在狱吏中树敌是毫无道理的。

sentences.english: Maintain modesty, don't show opulent, don't create envy and enemies.
sentences.chinese: 保持谦逊的作风，不要露富，以免引起嫉妒甚至树敌。
你是在交朋友还是在树敌？

sentences.english: Is it worth making an enemy?
They can make a friend or make an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 它们能让人交朋友或者与人树敌。

sentences.english: I make enemies numerous, but have never wel opponent.
sentences.chinese: 我树敌无数，却从未逢对手。
你是在交朋友还是在树敌？

definition: to start a feud/to become enemies
to arouse dislike/to incur hatred
to stir up trouble
to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to stir up trouble
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to let emotions affect one's decisions
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
lit. a tall tree attracts the wind (idiom)/fig. a famous or rich person attracts criticism
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to cause trouble
to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
to offend sb/to make a faux pas/a faux pas/see also 得罪[de2 zui4]
to commit an offense/to violate the law/excuse me! (formal)/see also 得罪[de2 zui5]
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
